author: admin
title: Keeper Security Announces Upgraded Platform
text:
Submitted by admin on 10/9/2015 @ 7:45 AM   Keeper Security 
CHICAGO, IL--(Marketwired - October 09, 2015) - Keeper Security, Inc. , creator of Keeper, the world's most downloaded password manager and digital vault, announced today that Keeper has launched shared folders on all mobile and desktop platforms. Keeper also launched support for iOS 9, Apple watchOS 2 and Android M. 
Shared folders simplifies secure password and file sharing. It's an integral feature for Keeper Enterprise customers; shared folders empower IT departments to instantly provision user credentials and secure files across entire departments and teams within an organization. This makes large-scale user provisioning and new employee onboarding fast and frictionless. 
"In launching shared folders, we're providing a more elegant way for enterprises to securely share folders of Keeper records across an organization. Our customers are excited about the roadmap for Keeper Enterprise. Shared folders represents a major upgrade to our platform where we continue to invest heavily," said Darren Guccione, CEO at Keeper Security. 
This week, Keeper is exhibiting at the Gartner Symposium/ITXpo 2015 in Orlando, Florida where it's showcasing Keeper Enterprise to CIOs and CISOs from Global 2000 corporations. 
About Keeper Security 
Keeper Security, Inc. is the creator of Keeper, the world's most downloaded password manager and digital vault. Founded in 2009 by Darren Guccione (CEO) and Craig Lurey (CTO), Keeper Security is privately-held and is based in Chicago, Illinois with engineering offices in El Dorado Hills, California. Keeper is SOC certified and utilizes world-class encryption to safeguard its users. Keeper is available on all major Smartphones, Tablets and Computers -- covering iPhone, iPad, Android, Mac, PC, BlackBerry, Kindle and Windows Phone. 
Keeper Enterprise is a zero-knowledge platform that helps businesses protect all types of sensitive digital assets including passwords, notes, documents and photos. The platform utilizes the industry's strongest security protocols including 256-bit AES encryption, two-factor authentication and PBKDF2 key generation while also having the industry's strongest certifications -- SOC 2, TRUSTe, Qualys and HIPAA. 
For more information please visit https://keepersecurity.com . Contact:
